block.p: Alexa Key Zwack, an assistant expedition leader on the exploration cruise ship M. S. Caledonian Star, was married yesterday to Niklas Per Hakan Peterstam, the ship's chief officer. The Rev. Dr. Mark Anschutz officiated at St. James' Episcopal Church in New York. The Rev. Johan Wierup, a Lutheran minister, took part in the ceremony.

Mrs. Peterstam, 33, graduated from Lake Forest College. She is a daughter of Iris Argento of Far Hills, N.J., and Peter Zwack of Budapest and Bolgheri, Italy. The bride's father owns J. Zwack & Company, a distiller of liqueurs in Budapest, and was until recently Hungary's Ambassador to the United States. The bride is a stepdaughter of Anne Marshall Zwack, a freelance writer in Bolgheri, and of the late Henry F. Argento.

Alexa Key Zwack, an assistant expedition leader on the exploration cruise ship M. S. Caledonian Star, was married yesterday to Niklas Per Hakan Peterstam, the ship's chief officer. The Rev. Dr. Mark Anschutz officiated at St. James' Episcopal Church in New York. The Rev. Johan Wierup, a Lutheran minister, took part in the ceremony.

Mrs. Peterstam, 33, graduated from Lake Forest College. She is a daughter of Iris Argento of Far Hills, N.J., and Peter Zwack of Budapest and Bolgheri, Italy. The bride's father owns J. Zwack & Company, a distiller of liqueurs in Budapest, and was until recently Hungary's Ambassador to the United States. The bride is a stepdaughter of Anne Marshall Zwack, a freelance writer in Bolgheri, and of the late Henry F. Argento.

Mr. Peterstam, 28, received a master mariner degree from the University of Goteborg in Sweden. He is a son of Nils and Dagny Peterstam of Skarhamn, Sweden. The bridegroom's mother is a pharmacist in Tjorn, Sweden. His father is a chief officer for Stena Lines, a ferryboat company in Goteborg.
